content.description: Scramble up the boulder pile to the right. Make a long reach to clip the first bolt. Continue up the lichen covered, steep, slabby boulder past one more bolt. There is a tremendous amount of thick lichen on this boulder that makes the climbing feel insecure. It also tends to flake off and rain down on your belayer. In addition, there is some loose rock toward the top.
content.protection: Two bolts protect the face. There are double bolted rap anchors located on the far wall. It is possible to belay off of these anchors by extending with the climbing rope or taking somethinng long to extend with. The anchors are shared with Rowen's Squeeze.
content.location: Located on the steep slabby face of the boulder which forms the roof of Cave In. Go to the tree near the back entrance of the cave and look up.

content.description: START AT THE RIGHT LEANING CRACK AND LARGE SLAB TO THE RIGHT OF CRACK CLIMB TO TOP OF SLAB FOR A QUIK BREAK THEN LARGE TO NARROW CHIMNEY TO TOP
content.protection: SMALL PRO TO #1 CAMALOT TO START THEN HARD TO PROTECT FROM THERE LARGE CAM OR BIG BRO AFTER SELF
content.location: THIS IS THE OFFWIDTH CHIMNEY IN THE SOUTHEAST CORNER OF THE CAVE IN AREA THE BEGINING IS MARKED BY A RIGHT LEANING CRACK WICH IF CLIMBED BY ITSELF IS CONSIDERED A BOULDER PROBLEM CALLED HANGATANG

content.description: Located on Rappeller's Rock. Start in the wide groove and follow the seam up to the overlap/flake that forms the crack and then continue up lower angle (easier, but less protectable) rock to the top. The crux is reaching the crack and is well protected by the single bolt. The crack at the start of this route is often wet, but can be avoided.
content.protection: Single bolt and small gear. Bring a long cordalette or static rope to make an anchor around the feature at the top of the formation. It is possible to walk off the backside.
content.location: On your left as you are walking into the triple cracks area.

content.description: TO THE LEFT OF TRIPLE CRACKS FOLLOWING THE GREEN TRAIL MARKER A LARGE SHADED COOL IN THE SUMMER CAVE WITH A MIX OF ROUTES
